name: Pina Colada Fruit Jellies
author: Mott's
summary: Fruit jellies are a simple and sweet treat, but when you give them a pina colada flavor, you just might find them addicting.
ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package pineapple-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)
½ cup granulated sugar for coating
directions: Spray an 8x8-inch baking dish with non-fat cooking spray
Combine granulated sugar, applesauce, pineapple-flavored gelatin, unflavored gelatin, lime juice, and coconut extract in saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly
Remove saucepan from heat, and cool at room temperature for about 10 minutes
(Do not pour boiling hot liquid into a chilled glass dish
) Remove baking dish from refrigerator, and pour warm mixture into the cooled baking dish
When firm, remove from refrigerator, lift one side with a spatula, and turn out onto a cutting board or parchment paper sprinkled with granulated sugar
Using a sharp knife, cut gelatin into squares or use a small cookie cutter for decorative shapes
Coat the jellies on all sides with sugar
Place on a rack, and allow to dry overnight
